data.title: Allow setting multiple render targets using Painter (Starling 2.0)
data.body:
I'd like to suggest modifying Painter and RenderState to support setting multiple render targets.

In my case, I do need to specify all 4 RTs and doing this directly on context object would probably beat the purpose of Painter state mechanism. Also, I'm not sure how I would handle applyClipRect myself, since it should be done automatically by Painter.

So why not make this

``` actionscript
public function setRenderTarget(target:Texture, antiAlias:int=0):void
```

to look like this:

``` actionscript
public function setRenderTarget(target:Texture, antiAlias:int=0, colorOutputIndex:int=0):void
```

data.title: Updated copyright to 2016
MovieClip with changing frame size
data.body:
I want to be able to use MovieClip but I want to get the real size of it during animation, currently it takes the first frame size. I can call `readjustSize` to make it update the size according to the current texture's size.
The problem is that I'm getting the error `[Starling] Warning: frames inside the texture's region are unsupported.` if I use atlas (With frames). should I just ignore this warning?

Thanks
Gil Amran

data.title: AssetManager enqueuing File subclass won't work
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

i know it's pretty uncommon to subclass File class but if  you do so you won't be able to enque those files using AssetManager.

data.title: Utility function: insertIntAt
data.body:
Hi! I have just download the framework. In the class VectorUtil, I see this function:

```
/** Inserts a value into the 'int'-Vector at the specified index. Supports negative
         *  indices (counting from the end); gaps will be filled up with zeroes. */
        public static function insertIntAt(vector:Vector.<int>, index:int, value:uint):void
```

I think the third param should be: value:int instead of value:uint
Did I miss something?

data.title: Using Context3DBufferUsage in QuadBatch
data.body:
Even though some people saying that you won't benefit much from setting bufferUsage, I think that it's not bad to give GPU driver a hint. Would you mind adding support for it?

In my OpenFL port, I'm using STATIC_DRAW only for flattend sprites. For everything else I'm using DYNAMIC_DRAW.

data.title: Problem about SystemUtil.executeWhenApplicationIsActive
Starling 1.7, ATF: Error #3677: Texture decoding failed. Internal error.
data.body:
Hi.

We are getting a occasional Error #3677 error on Android when using an assetManager to load atlases for changing graphic themes in the app (which use a different set of atlases each). The app works correctly but after switching themes a few times it throws the error.

To switch themes we call `dispose()` followed by `purge()` and then load all the assets for the new theme.

We have ATF textures with ETC1+alpha encoding created using TexturePacker in 2048x2048.

Device: LG Nexus 5 Android 6

Updated to Starling 1.7 but the error is still there. We need to release this app ASAP, we ran out of options.

Please help!

data.body: starling can be provided to the developers choose to use "Worker" . "Worker" can be used in the calculation , rendering and processing material (class AssetManager).

data.title: Update flex sdk to last release
Added repeat property to FragmentFilter to allow wrapping AGAL shaders.
data.body: This is a fix for issue 778 (https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/issues/778)

data.title: FragmentFilter passTexture is always a RectangleTexture
data.body: In the FragmentFilter.updatePassTextures() method, the pass textures are created with the call: Texture.empty(width, height, PMA, false, true, scale). This means that unless using the 'baselineConstrained' profile, a RectangleTexture is always created. While this is nice performance-wise, a RectangleTexture cannot be wrapped/repeated - so if the AGAL shader in the filter being applied uses the 'repeat' or 'wrap' flag in the texture sample, the filter will fail. I haven't found a clean solution to suggest, but it seems the pass textures should be created with the repeat property set to the repeat property of the filtered display object's texture.

data.title: Method removeChild():DisplayObject never returns null

milestone.title: Starling 2.0
milestone.description: This release will come with a much more flexible rendering architecture and some other changes I've been wishing to make for a long time. It won't be compatible with the old releases, though: several APIs will change.

data.body:
I'd expect `removeChild()` to return `null` if the given child was not removed (because it's not a child of the given parent), so I could, for example, use it to check if the parent has changed as a result of this call.

Currently, it always returns the object passed as `child`, which is not really that useful.

data.title: fixed potential memory leak in AssetManager.loadQueue that would prevent the calling object from garbage collection
Sprite3D and hitTest
Sprite's flatten() ignores/does not use QuadBatch's forceTinted
Feature requests for Starling 2.0
Starling pause
data.body:
Hi!

I am having a problem with performance in an ANE on iOS when running Starling(and Feathers).
I partially solved it setting Starling.current.nativeStage.frameRate = 1 when the ANE is active. This makes the ANE perform well, but the navigation(button in feathers) that closes the the ANE is responding a bit slow.
I am guessing this is connected to Starling rendering in a low framerate, it responds much faster when I leave the frameRate at 60.

In my case I don't need to update any visual stuff but I still want receive touches fast.
Do you have any suggestion on how to go about to solve this. 

Here is a link to a thread in the forum that discuss this problem. It's quite old and maybe Starling has been updated with some new feature that solves my problem.
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/how-to-pause-starling

data.title: Setting onRestore always calls removeEventListener() which allocates a Vector.<Function>
Small changes
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

Thanks for doing an amazing job. I have edit some minor details;

1) Removed Dead code:

starling/src/starling/display/DisplayObject.as line 285

The context of the code will not be executed after the line: throw new AbstractMethodError();
So, return null is not necessary.

2) Adding unused optimizeForRenderToTexture parameter:

starling/src/starling/textures/Texture.as line 150

The respective parameter was never used, instead a default value "false".

3) Removed unused variable:

starling/src/starling/utils/VertexData.as line 380

The respective variable: var color:uint; is not being used at all.

data.title: Loading bitmap font texture from texture atlas
DisplayObjectContainer getBounds should ignore the invisible children
Convert to PMA at the shader if needed and wanted (#762)
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

I tried to be a little invasive as possible and to follow your "style".
I added a flag on starling to request the non PMA texture to be converted to PMA, false by default so it should keep the old code exactly as fast as before.
If the flag is set to true, then It'll convert the non PMA texture to PMA in the shader and force blending to consider everything as PMA (regardless of the original texture format).

It fix all our blending issues.

Thanks for your time (Simas told me that v2-beta is across the corner, can't wait!)

Seb
